title: Compiler panic: feature(let_chains)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(let_chains)] ...snip... use sqlx::PgPool; ...snip... #[async_std::main] async fn main() -> tide::Result<()> { ...snip... if let Some(_) = postgres_reset && let Some(connected_postgres) = postgres { reset_postgres(connected_postgres)?; } ...snip... Ok(()) } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.52.0-nightly (3f5aee2d5 2021-02-12) binary: rustc commit-hash: 3f5aee2d5241139d808f4fdece0026603489afd1 commit-date: 2021-02-12 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.52.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.0-nightly (3f5aee2d5 2021-02-12) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
